tool.name: create_note
tool.description: Create a personal note for observations, findings, and research during the scan.
tool.details: Use this tool for documenting discoveries, observations, methodology notes, and questions. This is your personal notepad for recording information you want to remember or reference later. For tracking actionable tasks, use the todo tool instead.

returns.description: Response containing: - note_id: ID of the created note - success: Whether the note was created successfully

tool.examples:
# Document an interesting finding
Interesting Directory Found Found /backup/ directory that might contain sensitive files. Directory listing seems disabled but worth investigating further. findings ["directory", "backup"]
# Methodology note
Authentication Flow Analysis The application uses JWT tokens stored in localStorage. Token expiration is set to 24 hours. Observed that refresh token rotation is not implemented. methodology ["auth", "jwt", "session"]
# Research question
Custom Header Investigation The API returns a custom X-Request-ID header. Need to research if this could be used for user tracking or has any security implications. questions ["headers", "research"]

parameter.name: note_id
parameter.description: ID of the note to delete

returns.description: Response containing: - success: Whether the note was deleted successfully

tool.name: list_notes
tool.description: List existing notes with optional filtering and search.

parameter.name: tags
parameter.description: Filter by tags (returns notes with any of these tags)

parameter.name: search
parameter.description: Search query to find in note titles and content

returns.description: Response containing: - notes: List of matching notes - total_count: Total number of notes found

tool.examples:
# List all findings
findings
# Search for SQL injection related notes
SQL injection
# Search within a specific category
admin findings

parameter.name: note_id
parameter.description: ID of the note to update

returns.description: Response containing: - success: Whether the note was updated successfully
